StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Center for Mendelian Genomics [CMG] - The Broad Institute Joint Center for Mendelian Genomics

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
It is NIH’s intent to promote the dissemination of research findings from controlled-access dataset(s) subject to the GDS Policy as widely as possible through scientific publication or other appropriate public dissemination mechanisms. Approved Users are strongly encouraged to publish their results in peer-reviewed journals and to present research findings at scientific meetings.
Approved Users agree to acknowledge the Contributing Investigator(s) who submitted data from the original study to dbGaP, the primary funding organization that supported the Contributing Investigators, and the NIH-designated data repository, in all oral and written presentations, disclosures, and publications resulting from any analyses of controlled-access data obtained through the attached DAR. Approved Users further agree that the acknowledgment shall include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed. A sample acknowledgment statement for the Joint Center for Mendelian Genomics – Inherited Retinal Diseases dataset(s) follows:
"We thank the Broad Institute for generating sequencing data supported by NHGRI funds (grant #UM1 HG008900) with Daniel MacArthur and Heidi Rehm as PIs. The datasets used in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap through dbGaP accession number phs000XXX".

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (according to a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Kidney and Related Disorders, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-KRD-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Kidney and Related Disorders and related disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (No Insurance companies, employers, or the police until required by court order or by law)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-NIC-EMP-LENF
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to No Insurance companies, employers, or the police until required by court order or by law.
General Research Use - No uses by insurance companies, employers, or the police unless required by a court order or by law

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Bone Failure Disorders, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BFD-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Bone Failure Disorders. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Neurology, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-NEUROLOGY-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Neurology. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
Use of the data includes research on related genetic disorders and conditions.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cardiovascular Disease, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CVD-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cardiovascular Disease. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
